00003 use strict;
00004 use Carp;
00005 
00006 =head1 NAME
00007 
00008     Hermite.pm
00009 
00010 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00011 
00012       Usage:
00013                 $obj = new Hermit(\@x_values, \y_valuses \@yp_values);
00014 
00015         #get and set methods
00016                 $ra_x_values = $obj -> ra_x(\@x_values);
00017         $ra_y_values = $obj -> ra_y;
00018         $ra_yp_values = $obj -> ra_yp;
00019 
00020         $obj -> initialize;           # calculates the approximation
00021 
00022         #get methods
00023         $rf_function                  = $obj -> rf_f;
00024         $rf_function_derivative       = $obj -> rf_fp;
00025         $rf_function_2nd_derivative   = $obj -> rf_fpp;
00026 
00027         $rh_critical_points           =$obj -> rh_critical_points
00028         $rh_inflection_points         =$obj -> rh_inflection_points
00029 
00030 
00031 
00032 
00033 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00034 
00035 This module defines an object containing a Hermite spline approximation to a function.
00036   The approximation
00037 consists of a piecewise cubic polynomial which agrees with the original
00038 function and its first derivative at
00039 the node points.
00040 
00041 This is useful for creating on the fly graphics.  Care must be taken to use a small
00042 number of points spaced reasonably far apart, preferably
00043 points with alternating slopes, since this will minimize
00044 the number of extraneous critical points
00045 introduced.  Too many points will introduce many small variations and
00046 a large number of extraneous critical points.
00047 
00048 There are even more extraneous inflections points.
00049 This parameter is probably not very useful.   A different
00050 approximation scheme needs to be used.
00051 
00052 =cut
00053 
00054 
00055 # an object that contains a cubic hermite spline
00056 
00057 package Hermite;

00060 sub new {
00061     my $class = shift;
00062     my ($ra_x,$ra_y,$ra_yp) = @_;
00063     my $self = {
00064              ra_x               =>  [],
00065          ra_y               =>  [],
00066          ra_yp              =>  [],
00067          rf_f               =>  0,   # refers to a subroutine for the function
00068          rf_fp              =>  0,   # refers to a subroutine for the derivative of the function
00069          rf_fpp             =>  0,   # refers to a subroutine for the second derivative of the function
00070          rh_critical_points     =>  {},
00071          rh_inflection_points       =>  {},
00072          rh_maximum_points      =>  {},
00073          rh_minimum_points      =>  {},
00074     };
00075     bless $self, $class;
00076     $self->define($ra_x,$ra_y,$ra_yp) if ref($ra_x) eq 'ARRAY' and ref($ra_y) eq 'ARRAY' and ref($ra_yp) eq 'ARRAY';
00077     $self;
00078 }
00079 
00080 sub define{
00081     my $self   = shift;
00082     my $ra_x  = shift;
00083     my $ra_y  = shift;
00084     my $ra_yp = shift;
00085     $self->ra_x($ra_x);
00086     $self->ra_y($ra_y);
00087     $self->ra_yp($ra_yp);
00088 
00089     $self -> initialize();
00090     ($self->{x_ref},$self->{y_ref}, $self->{yp_ref} )
00091 }
00092 
00093 sub initialize {
00094     my $self = shift;
00095     # define the functions rf_f
00096 
00097     $self -> {rf_f} = hermite_spline($self -> {ra_x}, $self -> {ra_y}, $self -> {ra_yp} );
00098 #     # define the function  rf_fp
00099      $self -> {rf_fp} = hermite_spline_p($self -> {ra_x}, $self -> {ra_y}, $self -> {ra_yp} );
00100 #     # define the function  rf_fp
00101      $self -> {rf_fpp} = hermite_spline_pp($self -> {ra_x}, $self -> {ra_y}, $self -> {ra_yp} );
00102 #     # define the critical points
00103      %{$self -> {rh_critical_points}} = critical_points($self -> {ra_x}, $self -> {ra_y}, $self -> {ra_yp},
00104                                                      $self -> { rf_f },
00105                              );
00106 #     # define the inflection_points
00107      %{$self -> {rh_inflection_points}} = inflection_points($self -> {ra_x}, $self -> {ra_y}, $self -> {ra_yp} ,
00108                                                      $self -> { rf_f },
00109                              );
00110 #     # define the maximum points
00111 
00112     # define the minimum points
00113 
00114 }

00171 sub critical_points{
00172     my $ra_x = shift;
00173     my $ra_y =shift;
00174     my $ra_yp = shift;
00175     my $rf_hermite_fun =shift;
00176     my %critical_points = ();
00177     my $last_index = @$ra_x -2;
00178     foreach my $i (0 .. $last_index ) {
00179         internal_critical_points($ra_x->[$i],   $ra_y->[$i],   $ra_yp->[$i],
00180                              $ra_x->[$i+1], $ra_y->[$i+1], $ra_yp->[$i+1],
00181                  \%critical_points,$rf_hermite_fun);
00182     }
00183     %critical_points;
00184 }
00185 
00186 sub inflection_points{
00187     my $ra_x = shift;
00188     my $ra_y =shift;
00189     my $ra_yp = shift;
00190     my $rf_hermite_fun =shift;
00191     my %inflection_points = ();
00192     my $last_index = @$ra_x -2;
00193     foreach my $i (0 .. $last_index ) {
00194         internal_inflection_points($ra_x->[$i],   $ra_y->[$i],   $ra_yp->[$i],
00195                              $ra_x->[$i+1], $ra_y->[$i+1], $ra_yp->[$i+1],
00196                  \%inflection_points,$rf_hermite_fun);
00197     }
00198     %inflection_points;
00199 }
00200 sub internal_critical_points{
00201     my ($x0,$l,$lp, $x1,$r,$rp, $rh_roots ,$rf_function) = @_;
00202      #data for one segment of the hermite spline
00203 
00204      # coefficients for the approximating polynomial
00205 
00206      my @a = (   $l,
00207                   $lp,
00208           -$lp/2 + (3*(-$lp - 2*($l - $r) - $rp))/2 + $rp/2,
00209           $lp + 2*($l - $r) + $rp
00210                );
00211 
00212     my ($root1, $root2, $z1,$z2);
00213     if ( $a[3] == 0 ) {
00214     if ( $a[2] == 0 ) {
00215     } else {
00216         $root1 = -$a[1]/( 2*$a[2] );
00217         if ( 0 <= $root1 and $root1 < 1) {
00218         $z1 = $root1*($x1-$x0) + $x0;
00219 
00220             $rh_roots -> {$z1} = &$rf_function($z1);
00221         }
00222     }
00223    } else {
00224     my $discriminent = (4*$a[2]**2 - 12*$a[1]*$a[3]);
00225 
00226 
00227     if ( $discriminent >= 0 ) {
00228         $discriminent = $discriminent**0.5;
00229         $root1 = (-2*$a[2] - $discriminent )/( 6*$a[3] );
00230         $root2 = (-2*$a[2] + $discriminent )/( 6*$a[3] );
00231         $z1 = $root1*($x1-$x0) + $x0;
00232         $z2 = $root2*($x1-$x0) + $x0;
00233         $rh_roots -> {$z1} = &$rf_function($z1) if  0 <= $root1 and $root1 < 1;
00234         $rh_roots -> {$z2} = &$rf_function($z1) if  0 <= $root2 and $root2 < 1;
00235     }
00236     }
00237 }
00238 
00239 sub internal_inflection_points {
00240     my ($x0,$l,$lp,,$x1,$r,$rp,$rh_roots,$rf_function) = @_;
00241      #data for one segment of the hermite spline
00242 
00243      # coefficients for the approximating polynomial
00244 
00245      my @a = (   $l,
00246                   $lp,
00247           -$lp/2 + (3*(-$lp - 2*($l - $r) - $rp))/2 + $rp/2,
00248           $lp + 2*($l - $r) + $rp
00249                );
00250     if ($a[3] == 0 ) {
00251     } else {
00252     my $root1 = -$a[2]/( 3*$a[3] );
00253     my $z1 = $root1*($x1-$x0) + $x0;
00254     $rh_roots -> {$z1} = &$rf_function($z1) if  0 <= $root1 and $root1 < 1;
00255     }
00256 
00257 }

00261 sub cubic_hermite {
00262     my ( $x0, $y0,$yp0, $x1, $y1, $yp1 ) = @_;
00263     my @a;
00264     my $width = $x1 - $x0;
00265     $yp0 = $yp0*$width;  # normalize to unit width
00266     $yp1 = $yp1*$width;
00267 
00268     $a[0] = $y0;
00269     $a[1] = $yp0;
00270     $a[2] = -3*$y0 - 2*$yp0 +3*$y1 -$yp1;
00271     $a[3] = 2*$y0 + $yp0 - 2*$y1 +$yp1;
00272 
00273     my $f = sub {
00274                         my $x = shift;
00275                         #normalize to unit width
00276             $x = ( $x - $x0 )/$width;
00277             ( ($a[3]*$x + $a[2]) * $x + $a[1] )*$x + $a[0];
00278 
00279                 };
00280     $f;
00281 }
00282 
00283 sub cubic_hermite_p {
00284     my ( $x0, $y0,$yp0, $x1, $y1, $yp1 )=@_;
00285     my @a;
00286     my $width = $x1 - $x0;
00287     $yp0 = $yp0*$width;  # normalize to unit width
00288     $yp1 = $yp1*$width;
00289 
00290     $a[0] = $y0;
00291     $a[1] = $yp0;
00292     $a[2] = -3*$y0 - 2*$yp0 +3*$y1 -$yp1;
00293     $a[3] = 2*$y0 + $yp0 - 2*$y1 +$yp1;
00294 
00295     my $fp = sub {
00296                         my $x = shift;
00297                         #normalize to unit width
00298             $x = ( $x - $x0 )/$width;
00299             ( (3*$a[3]*$x + 2*$a[2]) * $x + $a[1] )/$width ;
00300                 };
00301 
00302 
00303 
00304      $fp;
00305 
00306 }
00307 
00308 sub cubic_hermite_pp {
00309     my ( $x0, $y0,$yp0, $x1, $y1, $yp1 ) = @_;
00310     my @a;
00311     my $width = $x1 - $x0;
00312     $yp0 = $yp0*$width;  # normalize to unit width
00313     $yp1 = $yp1*$width;
00314 
00315     $a[0] = $y0;
00316     $a[1] = $yp0;
00317     $a[2] = -3*$y0 - 2*$yp0 +3*$y1 -$yp1;
00318     $a[3] = 2*$y0 + $yp0 - 2*$y1 +$yp1;
00319 
00320 
00321 
00322     my $fpp = sub {
00323                         my $x = shift;
00324                         #normalize to unit width
00325             $x = ( $x - $x0 )/$width;
00326              (6*$a[3]*$x + 2*$a[2])/$width**2 ;
00327                 };
00328 
00329     $fpp;
00330 }

00334 sub hermite_spline {
00335     my ($xref, $yref, $ypref) = @_;
00336     my @xvals  = @$xref;
00337     my @yvals  = @$yref;
00338     my @ypvals = @$ypref;
00339     my $x0 = shift @xvals;
00340     my $y0 = shift @yvals;
00341     my $yp0 = shift @ypvals;
00342     my ($x1,$y1,$yp1);
00343     my @polys;  #calculate a hermite polynomial evaluator for each region
00344 
00345     while (@xvals) {
00346         $x1 = shift @xvals;
00347         $y1 = shift @yvals;
00348         $yp1 = shift @ypvals;
00349 
00350         push @polys, cubic_hermite($x0, $y0, $yp0 , $x1, $y1 , $yp1);
00351         $x0  = $x1;
00352         $y0  = $y1;
00353         $yp0 = $yp1;
00354     }
00355 
00356 
00357     my $hermite_spline_function = sub {
00358         my $x = shift;
00359         my $y;
00360         my $fun;
00361         my @xvals = @$xref;
00362         my @fns = @polys;
00363         return &{$fns[0]} ($x) if $x == $xvals[0]; #handle left most endpoint
00364 
00365         while (@xvals && $x > $xvals[0]) {  # find the function for this range of x
00366             shift(@xvals);
00367             $fun = shift(@fns);
00368         }
00369 
00370         # now that we have the left hand of the input
00371         #check first that x isn't out of range to the left or right
00372         if (@xvals  && defined($fun) )  {
00373             $y =&$fun($x);
00374         }
00375         $y;
00376     };
00377     $hermite_spline_function;
00378 }
00379 
00380 sub hermite_spline_p {
00381     my ($xref, $yref, $ypref) = @_;
00382     my @xvals  = @$xref;
00383     my @yvals  = @$yref;
00384     my @ypvals = @$ypref;
00385     my $x0 = shift @xvals;
00386     my $y0 = shift @yvals;
00387     my $yp0 = shift @ypvals;
00388     my ($x1,$y1,$yp1);
00389     my @polys;  #calculate a hermite polynomial evaluator for each region
00390     while (@xvals) {
00391         $x1 = shift @xvals;
00392         $y1 = shift @yvals;
00393         $yp1 = shift @ypvals;
00394         push @polys, cubic_hermite_p($x0, $y0, $yp0 , $x1, $y1 , $yp1);
00395         $x0  = $x1;
00396         $y0  = $y1;
00397         $yp0 = $yp1;
00398     }

00409         while (@xvals && $x > $xvals[0]) {  # find the function for this range of x
00410             shift(@xvals);

00424     my ($xref, $yref, $ypref) = @_;
00425     my @xvals  = @$xref;
00426     my @yvals  = @$yref;
00427     my @ypvals = @$ypref;

00430     my $yp0 = shift @ypvals;

00435         $y1 = shift @yvals;
00436         $yp1 = shift @ypvals;
